html: Bit of clarity needed - being against this deal implies support for one of: 1. No deal 2. No Brexit 3. Canada + with NI only backstop So opponents of the deal should be clear which one they support. There is no other magic option.
text:
Bit of clarity needed - being against this deal implies support for one of:

1. No deal
2. No Brexit
3. Canada + with NI only backstop

So opponents of the deal should be clear which one they support.

There is no other magic option.

html: I am very disappointed that the bill on upskirting did not progress today. We remain committed to making sure that it becomes a criminal offence and have every expectation that this will happen.
text: I am very disappointed that the bill on upskirting did not progress today.  We remain committed to making sure that it becomes a criminal offence and have every expectation that this will happen.

text:
Yesterday, on College Green, RT reporter and camera crew came up to me asking questions.

ME: I don't do interviews with RT.

INTERVIEWER: Why not?

ME: You're a propaganda station. Reputable politicians don't do interviews with RT.

INTERVIEWER: We've just had John McDonnell on.

text: A rare intervention by a senior civil servant, but @NeilCouling is right: #Moneybox's piece on #UniversalCredit was wrong and misleading. UC is changing lives for the betterhttps://twitter.com/davidgauke/status/931867569874759681 …

html: Worth looking at tweets of @NeilCouling to understand why #Moneybox piece on #UniversalCredit misleading and inaccurate.
text: Worth looking at tweets of @NeilCouling to understand why #Moneybox piece on #UniversalCredit misleading and inaccurate.

html: #Moneybox #UniversalCredit story. This so called problem would have occurred at Christmas 2013, 2014, 2015 and 2016. In fact it is just the system working as intended, adjusting to changes in household income. We've not seen problems with this in the past and won't this year.
text: #Moneybox #UniversalCredit story.   This so called problem would have occurred at Christmas 2013, 2014, 2015 and 2016.  In fact it is just the system working as intended, adjusting to changes in household income.  We've not seen problems with this in the past and won't this year.

html: #Moneybox #UniversalCredit story also says we can't provide figures. I don't know what people will be paid in December and neither does Moneybox. The 10s of thousands figure has no reasonable methodology underpinning it.
text: #Moneybox #UniversalCredit story also says we can't provide figures.  I don't know what people will be paid in December and neither does Moneybox.  The 10s of thousands figure has no reasonable methodology underpinning it.

html: #Moneybox #UniversalCredit story has also missed the point that in financial terms someone paid weekly is slightly better off over the course of a year than if we tried averaging. In 4 payday months UC is higher than av. and in 5 payday month UC is only reduced at rate of 63%
text: #Moneybox #UniversalCredit story has also missed the point that in financial terms someone paid weekly is slightly better off over the course of a year than if we tried averaging.  In 4 payday months UC is higher than av. and in 5 payday month UC is only reduced at rate of 63%

html: #Moneybox #UniversalCredit story based on the false premise that every weekly paid claimant gets their UC at the end of the month. In fact in December claimants will be paid on one of 31 days, their UC payday is specific to them.
text: #Moneybox #UniversalCredit story based on the false premise that every weekly paid claimant gets their UC at the end of the month.  In fact in December claimants will be paid on one of 31 days, their UC payday is specific to them.
